verses.text: But it displeased Jonah exceedingly, and he was very angry.

And he prayed unto the \sc Lord\sc*, and said, I pray thee, O \sc Lord\sc*, \add was\add* not this my saying, when I was yet in my country? Therefore I fled before unto Tarshish: for I knew that thou \add art\add* a gracious God, and merciful, slow to anger, and of great kindness, and repentest thee of the evil.
Therefore now, O \sc Lord\sc*, take, I beseech thee, my life from me; for \add it is\add* better for me to die than to live.
Then said the \sc Lord\sc*, Doest thou well to be angry?
So Jonah went out of the city, and sat on the east side of the city, and there made him a booth, and sat under it in the shadow, till he might see what would become of the city.

And the \sc Lord\sc* God prepared a gourd, and made \add it\add* to come up over Jonah, that \add it\add* might be a shadow over his head, to deliver him from his grief. So Jonah was exceeding glad of the gourd.
But God prepared a worm when the morning rose the next day, and it smote the gourd, that it withered.

And it came to pass, when the sun did arise, that God prepared a vehement east wind; and the sun beat upon the head of Jonah, that he fainted, and wished in himself to die, and said, \add It is\add* better for me to die than to live.
And God said to Jonah, Doest thou well to be angry for the gourd? And he said, I do well to be angry, \add even\add* unto death.
Then said the \sc Lord\sc*, Thou hast had pity on the gourd, for the which thou hast not laboured, neither madest it grow; which came up in a night, and perished in a night:

and should not I spare Nineveh, \add that\add* great city, wherein are more than sixscore thousand persons that cannot discern between their right hand and their left hand; and \add also\add* much cattle?
